questions.question: Which software layer serves as the interface between user programs and the computer hardware?
Hardware executes complex high-level operations directly without any translation.
What is the primary function of a compiler?
options: To translate symbolic notation into binary
To translate high-level language programs into hardware-executable instructions
To protect shared use among multiple applications
questions.answer: To translate high-level language programs into hardware-executable instructions

questions.question: Computers communicate using electrical signals represented by which digits?
Instructions in a computer can be thought of as numbers.
Which program translates symbolic notation (like 'add A, B') into binary machine language?
What is a major disadvantage of assembly language compared to high-level languages?
options: It is too natural to read
It requires one line of code for every instruction the computer follows
It is independent of the computer hardware
questions.answer: It requires one line of code for every instruction the computer follows

questions.question: Assembly language forces the programmer to 'think like the computer.'
Which of the following is NOT a benefit of high-level programming languages?
options: Programs become independent of the computer they were developed on
Programmers must write one line for every binary instruction
Programmers can use English words and algebraic notation
questions.answer: Programmers must write one line for every binary instruction
